page.title: 11Health-Law and Order
page.content: Residents of Thorncombe rceive health protection from doctors in Chard, Beaminster and Exminster. Chard doctors visit the village twice weekly. Dentists, Oculists, Clinics and Hospitals visits have to be made either by transport liad on by the health authority or by private car. Hospitals for severe illnesses or maternity cases are in Taunton, Yeovil and Dorchester, as are most other facilities necessary for health checks. The village bobby has been replaced by a weekly visit from the mobile policeman in his police car. The local joke is that the lawbreakers take Monday off when the bobby comes to the village. He is available to all who need his help and reassurance and in his half hour's stay calls on a few elderly folk and the shops. Two of our residents are special
